Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2017 12:36PM cece424 wrote: I really appreciate your response. After reading the statistics and the story of each and everyone on here, I think I have decided to have a bilateral. The worry and uncertainty is more than I want to deal with. Ive been told is rather drastic but I feel that its right for me.
Posts.Title: Radiation vs Mastectomy cece424 pollicakes

Posts.Content: cece424 wrote: I am really new at this...in fact I was told Friday the lumpectomy I had the week before is in fact cancer. I'm still at the stage...what do I do next based on additional tests. I dont know how to verbalize my fears or concerns but I would like to know anyone's feelings about radiation versus mastectomy. If you had one and wished you had the other? Is the recovery for one a little easier? I'm just throwing out questions that come to mind. I would appreciate ANY input you can give me. I have read the "official" information, I would like to hear from real women who have been impacted by this... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Radiation vs Mastectomy cece424 pollicakes
